quest.name: Into the Eye of the Storm
journal: Cid appears to be deep in thought.

In its current condition, the Enterprise cannot endure the tumultuous winds which encircle the Howling Eye, Garuda's sanctuary. To breach the barrier, Cid has devised a plan to harness the power of a corrupted crystal. While he himself has no idea where to find one, he knows a man who might─the scholar, Lamberteint, who resides in Camp Drybone.
After learning of your shared interest in corrupted crystals, Professor Lamberteint seems eager to discuss his work. With any luck, your time in Thanalan will be brief and forgettable.
objectives: Speak with Lamberteint in Camp Drybone.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It calms me to look at her.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It's as though I've been reunited with a part of me I never knew was missing...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hardly surprising. You did design and build her.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I bear good news! The Seedseers have granted our request to house the Enterprise. We may take as long as we require to repair her.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Of course, it would be rank folly to take one moment more than we require. Garuda, lest we forget, grows stronger by the hour. If we are to have any hope of wresting this benighted realm from her talons, it must needs be soon.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though I am no expert on the workings of airships, it seems plain to me that the Enterprise suffered much from her time in the wilderness. Am I not correct, Cid?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You are. Frankly, it's a miracle she carried us this far.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As you know, the Howling Eye is encircled by a raging tempest, apt to turn proud trees to matchwood. Our battle will end before it begins if the Enterprise cannot weather the storm.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Given time, I believe I can fully repair her...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But if this tempest is as fearsome as you say, even that may not be enough.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: <sigh> Confound it. There must be a way...a way to brave the fury of the elements...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...The elements. But of course! That's it!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We work upon the element itself! Using the power of a corrupted crystal, we could clear a path through the storm, and spare the Enterprise a battering!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see! You propose to utilize the properties of a crystal to alter the elemental aspect of the barrier! It seems so childishly simple in retrospect!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though mayhap not to you, Forename. We speak of the manifestations of over-aspected aether that can be found throughout Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Since the Calamity disrupted the land's aetheric currents, such crystals have become comparatively commonplace.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Which has been a cause of great woe, as they are known to warp aetheric energies, including those of living organisms.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The point is, we could theoretically use a corrupted crystal to convert the wind-aspected aether comprising Garuda's barrier into aether of another aspect─one she cannot control.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: With certain modifications, the Enterprise should be able to deliver us to the Howling Eye in comfort, however hard Garuda blows...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But we are getting ahead of ourselves. All of this rests upon our ability to procure a crystal with the necessary properties. Have you any idea where we might acquire one?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: No. But I know a man who might. A scholar by the name of Lamberteint, who resides in Camp Drybone.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Strange as it may sound, I met him during my time at the church. Well, Marques met him, I suppose. Whether out of pity, or for want of a more willing listener, he would talk to me for hours at a time about his aetheric studies, corrupted crystals being his pet subject. It was as a result of these conversations that poor Marques was observed to possess an uncommon knack for theoretical science...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename, I need you to return to Thanalan and seek out this scholar. Cid and I will set about repairing the Enterprise in your absence.

dialogue.name: LAMBERTEINT
dialogue.text: Hm? Why yes, I am Professor Lamberteint. Beg pardon? You wish to hear about my research on corrupted crystals? ...Truly? Well, nothing would give me greater pleasure than to discuss my work with a fellow womanman of science!

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. Do you wish to proceed to your vessel?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No
